programme.title: Salif Keita and Les Ambassadeurs
programme.desc: La música de Salif Keita, tambien conocido como "la voz de oro africana

programme.title: Wayne Shorter Quintet - Estival Jazz Lugano
programme.desc: En 1996, el famoso saxofonista estadounidense Wayne Shorter y su quinteto actuaron en el Estival Jazz Lugano. Junto con el pianista Jim Beard, el guitarrista David Gilmore, el bajista Alphonso Johnson y el baterista Rodney van Holmes, Shorter muestra que todavía está en su mejor momento.

programme.title: John Coltrane
programme.desc: Explore the music of one of the most influential and innovative saxophonists in jazz history: John Coltrane! Immerse yourself in this collection of remarkable performances from the early 1960s that showcase Coltranes unparalleled artistry and unique sound during a transformative period in the artist’s career. Recorded in various European cities, Coltrane is seen playing the songs “Autumn Leaves”, “Hackensack”, “My Favorite Things”, “I Want To Talk About You”, “Vigil”, and “Naima”. Tune in and experience why the music of John Coltrane has touched the lives of so many!

programme.title: Al Jarreau - The North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: En 1981, el cantante estadounidense y ganador del premio Grammy Al Jarreau dio una actuacion inolvidable para la audiencia del festival North Sea Jazz en La Haya, Países Bajos.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Great Male Vocalists - collage
programme.desc: This selection of unforgettable performances by some of the most iconic and influential male jazz and pop vocalists in history showcases these legends’ unique essence. Delight in the expressive beauty and emotional depth of Chet Bakers rendition of “Time After Time” and “You Dont Know What Love Is

programme.title: Dave Brubeck and Paul Desmond live in Belgium
programme.desc: Dave Brubeck: Live in 64 es un concierto hermosamente filmado de uno de los cuartetos más queridos de la historia del jazz. Paul Desmond (saxofon alto), Joe Morello (batería), Eugene Wright (bajo) y Dave Brubeck (piano) se convirtieron en un galardonado supergrupo de jazz.

programme.title: H. Silver, M. Waters, D. Gillespie - Newport Jazz
programme.desc: En 1968, el Newport Jazz Festival de Roterdam acogio a tres estadounidenses talentosos: el pianista Horace Silver, el guitarrista Muddy Waters y el trompetista Dizzy Gillespie junto a sus bandas.

programme.title: Somethin
programme.desc: Winner of five Grammys in four consecutive years, including the Grammy for best RandB album in 2017, Lalah Hathaway is a force impossible to ignore. The American artist has shared the scene with Prince, Snoop Dogg, Stevie Wonder, Anita Baker, Mary J. Blige, Frank Ocean and many others, an irrefutable proof of her keen musical sense and enormous talent. With a 26-year career, Hathaway is still highly sought after by the biggest names in music. See her transform the 2018 Sing Jazz festival scene into a real RandB club, where she flaunts her voice and stage presence out of the ordinary.

programme.title: Walter Trout Band - Jazzwoche Burghausen
programme.desc: Walter Trout, oriundo de Nueva Jersey pero residente en Los Ángeles, es un guitarrista y vocalista de blues rock contemporáneo de fama mundial. La Walter Trout Band actuo en la 50.° edicion de la Burghausen International Jazz Week en 2019.

programme.title: Avishai Cohen/Tscho Theissing, Arab Medley
programme.desc: Double bassist Avishai Cohen’s trio with Noam David (drums) and Omri Mor (pianist) joined forces with the international Symphony Orchestra ‘INSO-Lviv’, conducted by Christian Schumann. On June 24, 2017 they brought Avishai Cohen’s signature blend of influences from Eastern Europe, American jazz and the Middle East to the Alfa Jazz Festival in Lviv, Ukraine. Cohen, who also supplies vocalizations in the Judeo-Spanish dialect Ladino, came to prominence internationally in the 1990s when jazz great Chick Corea offered him a place in his trio and a recording deal. Thirty years later, Cohen has become a house-hold name himself, leaving his Ukrainian audience enthralled and connected through the universal language of music.

programme.title: Chick Corea and Friends
programme.desc: Muchas de las composiciones de Chick Corea se consideran estándares de jazz. Este especial presenta tres actuaciones que demuestran sus diferentes talentos.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: McCoy Tyner Trio live at Estival Lugano
programme.desc: McCoy Tyner es considerado uno de los pianistas de jazz más influyentes del siglo XX, un honor que gano con Coltrane y en los años en que siguio tocando despues de su muerte.

programme.title: El Guïje
programme.desc: Legendary Cuban pianist Chucho Valdes brought his band ‘Jazz Batá 2’ to the Malta Jazz Festival on July 19, 2019. The air was thick with anticipation as Valdes took to the stage, revisiting the small-group concept of his mythical 1972 Cuban album ‘Jazz Batá’. The batá repertoire – the deep classical music of West Africa – permeates Valdés’ piano solos throughout the concert. Valdes’s band consists of Dreiser Durruthy (Batas and vocals), Yaroldy Abreu (percussions and vocals), Abraham Mansfarroll (percussion), Ramon Vazquez Martirena-Bajo (bass guitar). They delivered a performance that reverberated through the historic island.

programme.title: Curtis Stigers - Fly Me To The Moon
programme.desc: The Danish Radio Big Band joins forces with American vocalist Curtis Stigers to celebrate Frank Sinatras iconic concerts at The Sands Hotel in Las Vegas. Curtis Stigers and the big band present the most popular evergreens from the American songbook of the 1950s and 1960s, one of which is the classic that lend the concert its name: “Fly Me To The Moon”.

programme.title: Hes My Guy
programme.desc: Vocalist Jazzmeia Horn’s 2019 Malta Jazz Festival appearance was a celebration of jazz’s future, infused with the soul of its past. Featuring Keith Brown (piano), Rashaan Carter (bass), Irwin Hall (flute and saxophone), and Anwar Marshall (drums), the young singer’s performance was a reminder of jazz’s enduring power to speak to the heart. Situated at the Valletta waterfront outside Our Lady of Liesse Church, Horn’s concert was a truly spellbinding experience.

programme.title: Christian Scott - The Centennial Trilogy
programme.desc: En su espectáculo de 2018 en La Cooperative de Mai, Christian Scott celebra los 100 años de jazz con el programa "The Centennial Trilogy". ¡Prepárate para una actuacion única en un entorno teatral íntimo, filmada en 4K nativo!

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Dave Brubeck and Paul Desmond live in Belgium
programme.desc: Dave Brubeck: Live in 64 es un concierto hermosamente filmado de uno de los cuartetos más queridos de la historia del jazz. Paul Desmond (saxofon alto), Joe Morello (batería), Eugene Wright (bajo) y Dave Brubeck (piano) se convirtieron en un galardonado supergrupo de jazz.

programme.title: H. Silver, M. Waters, D. Gillespie - Newport Jazz
programme.desc: En 1968, el Newport Jazz Festival de Roterdam acogio a tres estadounidenses talentosos: el pianista Horace Silver, el guitarrista Muddy Waters y el trompetista Dizzy Gillespie junto a sus bandas.

programme.title: Somethin
programme.desc: Winner of five Grammys in four consecutive years, including the Grammy for best RandB album in 2017, Lalah Hathaway is a force impossible to ignore. The American artist has shared the scene with Prince, Snoop Dogg, Stevie Wonder, Anita Baker, Mary J. Blige, Frank Ocean and many others, an irrefutable proof of her keen musical sense and enormous talent. With a 26-year career, Hathaway is still highly sought after by the biggest names in music. See her transform the 2018 Sing Jazz festival scene into a real RandB club, where she flaunts her voice and stage presence out of the ordinary.

programme.title: Munich Philharmonic Hall: Michel Camilo Quintet
programme.desc: La predisposicion del pianista de jazz Michel Camilo a arriesgarse constantemente hace que sus conciertos sean una aventura. En el Munchner Klaviersommer de 1991, Camilo dio un concierto muy variado con su quinteto.

programme.title: Toots Thielemans: A Jazz Legend
programme.desc: The harmonica player Toots Thielemans was born in Brussels, in 1922. He started playing the accordion at three years old, and when he was a child, he often played at his parents’ cafe. As an teenager, Thielemans mastered the harmonica, and then the guitar. In this documentary, Toots speaks about his rise to success. He explores his childhood in Brussels, his achievements in the United States, and his current status as a renown international musician. Toots’ long career is illustrated with archive footage and interviews with his mother, his manager, the seasoned comedian Raymond Devos, his rock star friends Paul Simon, Billy Joel, and Ozark Henry, his peers Herbie Hancock, Kenny Werner, Jaco Pastorius, and many more.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Thelonious Monk American Composer
programme.desc: The personal and conversational style documentary Thelonious Monk: American Composer was the first fully rounded portrait of Thelonious Sphere Monk, a terribly misunderstood man and musician finally given his due as a true original of American music. He was the pianistic ringleader of the bebop revolution and, after Duke Ellington, jazz’ first major composer. Appearing on the cover of Time Magazine in 1964, Monk had “arrived” as a top tier name in jazz. Monk - a most original talent - remained a highly productive musician even after thirty years of musical activity, always growing as an artist, exploring his art and extending his range. This documentary, filmed at Mintons Playhouse in New York City, includes conversations with Thelonious Monk III, Ben Riley, Billy Taylor, Orrin Keepnews and Randy Weston.

programme.title: Kenny Barron, Baila
programme.desc: Pianist Kenny Barron’s June 27, 2019 appearance at the Alfa Jazz Festival in Ukraine’s Lviv was a celebration of sublime jazz virtuosity. The revered elder statesmen of jazz piano brought his regular working trio of Kiyoshi Kitagawa (bass) and Jonathan Blake (drums), augmented by stellar jazzman Marcus Strickland (tenor saxophone) and young lion Riley Mulherkar (trumpet). Their seamless blend of classic bebop and modern explorations spoke of a deep, emotive connection to each note, captivating the Ukrainian audience with lyrical improvisations during this unforgettable concert.

programme.title: The Story of Jazz
programme.desc: The documentary The Story of Jazz is a seamless array of performances, commentary, and compelling historic insights about jazz, zooming in on the cross-cultural influences that produced this constantly evolving and enduring music. Many call jazz the greatest art form of the 20th century. This absorbing weave of sounds, rare film clips, stills and interviews shows how this truly American expression spread to become a universal, musical language, from the New Orleans traditions, stride, swing, boogie woogie, big band, jump band, blues, bebop, Afro-Cuban, cool, and free-form, to jazz vocalists and dancers… Never before have the filmed comments of so many important great jazz artists been assembled for one project, and never before has the history of jazz been told as vividly and with such attention to historic detail.

programme.title: Ahmad Jamal Trio - North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festival’s staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1989, legendary jazz pianist Ahmad Jamal brought his trio to the North Sea Jazz Festival. Accompanied by James Cammack on bass and David Bowler on drums, Jamal showcased his excellence.

programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Mahavishnu Orchestra - North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festival’s staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1986, the acclaimed jazz fusion group Mahavishnu Orchestra led by guitarist John McLaughlin took the stage at the North Sea Jazz Festival in The Hague. This third incarnation of the group featured an outstanding lineup, with Jim Beard on keyboards, Jonas Hellborg on bass, Danny Gottlieb on drums, and Bill Evans on saxophone.

programme.title: Woody Hermans Swinging Herd live in England 1964
programme.desc: Woody Herman: Live in 64 presenta un ardiente concierto de una hora que tuvo lugar en 1964, con una de las formaciones más populares de su "Swinging Herd".

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Modern Jazz Quartet - Live Concert
programme.desc: En 1969, el Modern Jazz Quartet se presento en el Singer Concertzaal de Laren para la television holandesa. Compuesto por Milt Jackson en el vibráfono, John Lewis en el piano, Percy Heath en el bajo y Connie Kay en la batería, el cuarteto toca con elegancia y estilo.

programme.title: While You Were Sleeping
programme.desc: ‘Jazz a Vienne’ is one of the worlds most prestigious jazz festivals. Ever since 1981 it has attracted leading jazz artists, with many of them playing return engagements. Unsurprisingly, the festivals 2013 edition did not fall short of expectations: the lineup was filled with the biggest names in music. Among them was Jose James. He was discovered by the legendary DJ and radio broadcaster Gilles Peterson. Joined on stage by Takuya Kuroda on trumpet, Solomon Dorsey on bass, Kris Bowers on keys, and Richard Spaven on drums, the singer is one of the prime examples of the direction jazz is heading towards.

programme.title: Episode 2: Dizzy Gillespie - Jazz Greats
programme.desc: El trompetista, compositor y líder de banda de jazz estadounidense Dizzy Gillespie (1917-1993) fue una figura fundamental del bebop, que fusiono influencias cubanas, latinoamericanas y caribeñas. El 4 de noviembre de 1970 se presento en Dinamarca con la Kenny Clarke/Francy Boland Big Band.

programme.title: Burton and Ozone - Munchner Klaviersommer
programme.desc: Munchner Klaviersommer was an annual concerts series that took place from 1981 to 1998 in Munich, Germany. Although the festivals name suggests a strong focus on piano music, it featured countless famous musicians from jazz and classical music – not just pianists. The concerts were usually held in July at The Gasteig, home of the Munich Philharmonic. In 1995, vibraphonist Gary Burton and pianist Makoto Ozone, both great jazz players noted for their virtuoso technique and innovative style, came together to give a concert of improvised music. They delighted the audience with their fluid, poetic artistry, which was expressed in a performance of the highest order.

programme.title: Great Guitarists - Collage
programme.desc: This selection of unforgettable performances by some of the most iconic and influential jazz guitarists in history showcases these legends’ unique essence. Revel in Wes Montgomery’s virtuosity as he performs the captivating “Nicas Dream” in Holland in 1965, and delight in the expressive beauty of his rendition of “Heres That Rainy Day”, recorded in London in that same year. Experience the timeless appeal of Joe Passs “You Stepped Out of a Dream” and “You Turned The Tables on Me”, recorded live in Hanover in 1975. The interplay between Jim Hall and Atilla Zoller borders on the impossible as they perform “Extensions” in Hanover in 1973. Enjoy Jim Halls lyrical solo performance of “Im Getting Sentimental Over You” from 1964. Witness Sonny Sharrock’s avant-garde fusion of jazz and rock in an exhilarating performance of “Peanut

programme.title: Ode to Miles: Bitches Brew Beyond
programme.desc: El trompetista Wallace Roney revive el legendario álbum de Miles Davis, Bitches Brew. En este proyecto, una creacion de la familia de Miles, participa su sobrino, el baterista Vince Wilburn. Este concierto en el teatro antiguo de Vienne, Francia, es un gran tributo al afamado trompetista.

programme.title: Live in Sydney
programme.desc: Seasick Steve es un bluesman estadounidense, aunque el prefiere que le llamen "hombre de la música y el baile". Toca diversas guitarras (casi todas personalizadas) y canta sobre todo temas sobre sus primeros años, en los que vivía en la calle y realizaba trabajos ocasionales.

programme.title: China Moses: Whatever at Jazz à Ramatuelle
programme.desc: In 1988, Dee Dee Bridgewater was one of the first great jazz singers to perform at the Jazz Festival in Ramatuelle. In 2016, the story seems to repeat itself as her daughter China Moses took the stage at Ramatuelle. Over the years, China Moses has become a mature performer with a unique style: rocky voice, sharp sense of swing, and intense/energetic stage presence. After signing compilations dedicated to Dinah Washington and blues, Moses released in 2016 an album of his own compositions, entitled "Whatever". Get ready for a most entertaining performance combining jazz, soul, and hip-hop.

programme.title: Michel Legrand Orchestra at Spa, 1982
programme.desc: Michel Legrand y su orquesta interpretan varias de sus amadas composiciones de bandas sonoras, "The Summer Knows

programme.title: Horace Silver
programme.desc: Legendary jazz pianist Horace Silvers groundbreaking fusion of hard bop, blues, soulful grooves and Cape Verdean influences have left an indelible mark on the world of jazz. At the renowned Umbria Jazz Festival in the picturesque region of Umbria, Italy, Silver is accompanied by a great band of future all-stars: Bob Berg on tenor sax, Tom Harrell on trumpet, Steve Beskrone on bass and Eddie Gladden on drums. During this performance from July 20, 1976, Silver’s quintet stretches out on four Silver originals: “Adjustment”, “Barbara”, “In Pursuit of the 27th Man”, and “Song For My Father”. Tune in and let Horace Silver’s irresistible music mesmerize you!

programme.title: Jazzed Out Oslo
programme.desc: Jazzed Out muestra que una sesion de jazz puede ocurrir en cualquier lugar. En este episodio, Oslo sirve como telon de fondo para las actuaciones de los pianistas Tord Gustavsen y Bugge Wesseltoft.

programme.title: Blue Monk
programme.desc: In 2019, the vibrant city of Sofia, Bulgaria, hosted the International A to JazZ Festival. Among the featured acts was the trailblazing jazz trumpeter Christian Scott aTunde Adjuah. This genre-defying artist captivated the audience with his eclectic “stretch music”; an approach that incorporates hip-hop and reaches back through the American canon into African percussion and its rich melodic content. Trumpeter Christian Scott aTunde Adjuah’s quintet, which includes drummer Corey Fonville, percussionist Weedie Braimah, pianist Lawrence Fields, and bass guitarist Max Mucha, delivered a performance that defied boundaries and expectations.

programme.title: Weather Update - Munchner Klaviersommer
programme.desc: En el Munchner Klaviersommer de 1986, el tecladista Joe Zawinul presento la nueva formacion de su banda de jazz fusion Weather Update. Lo acompañan Victor Bailey (bajo), Peter Erskine y Robert Thomas Jr. (percusion) y Steve Khan (guitarra).

programme.title: Popa Chubby - Its A Mighty Hard Road
programme.desc: Popa Chubby, born as Ted Horowitz, is an American blues singer and guitarist, who has become one of the most popular figures of New Yorks blues scene. Early on in his career he released the album Booty and the Beast (1995), which became one of the 1990ss best-selling blues albums. Chubby describes his own style as "The Stooges meets Buddy Guy, Motorhead meets Muddy Waters, and Jimi Hendrix meets Robert Johnson". As part of the French music festival Blues sur Seine, Chubby and his band played a great blues rock concert, showcasing the artist’s powerful and soulful guitar playing. This performance was recorded at Theâtre Simone Signoret on November 8, 2019.

programme.title: Rhoda Scott and La Velle: Hammond, Soul and Blues
programme.desc: Aunque la tecladista de soul y jazz estadounidense Rhoda Scott hizo la mayor parte de su carrera en Francia, este espectáculo en el teatro antiguo de Vienne es especial: una actuacion íntima y bella con la cantante estadounidense de gospel blues La Velle.

programme.title: John Coltrane
programme.desc: Explore the music of one of the most influential and innovative saxophonists in jazz history: John Coltrane! Immerse yourself in this collection of remarkable performances from the early 1960s that showcase Coltranes unparalleled artistry and unique sound during a transformative period in the artist’s career. Recorded in various European cities, Coltrane is seen playing the songs “Autumn Leaves”, “Hackensack”, “My Favorite Things”, “I Want To Talk About You”, “Vigil”, and “Naima”. Tune in and experience why the music of John Coltrane has touched the lives of so many!

programme.title: Louis Armstrong: Live in Australia
programme.desc: Following a highly successful small-group jazz concert at New York Town Hall on May 17, 1947, Armstrongs manager Joe Glaser dissolved the Armstrong big band on August 13, 1947 and established a six-piece small group. This group was called the All Stars, and in 1964 Louis Armstrong recorded his biggest-selling record, Hello, Dolly! He made assorted television appearances, especially in the 1950s and 1960s – the recorded film was a TV Show in Australia when Armstrong was at the peak of his career. Armstrong kept up his busy tour schedule until a few years before his death in 1971. He also toured Africa, Europe, and Asia under sponsorship of the US State Department with great success, earning the nickname ‘Ambassador Satch’.

programme.title: Caetano Veloso, Aquele Frevo Axe
programme.desc: Pianist Kenny Barron’s June 27, 2019 appearance at the Alfa Jazz Festival in Ukraine’s Lviv was a celebration of sublime jazz virtuosity. programme.title: Anita Oday Live in Sweden 1963
programme.desc: Anita ODay dio dos maravillosos conciertos en 1963 y 1970, que presentan a la “cantante suprema de jazz" en impecable forma. Este espectáculo es testimonio de una de las músicas de jazz más genuinas y muestra sin lugar a duda por que se la considera una vocalista de nivel superior.

programme.title: Gil Evans, Ornette Coleman - Schloss Ansbach
programme.desc: This program presents two concerts from Schloss Ansbach in 1978. The first concert features Gil Evans and his orchestra, consisting of Gil Evans on piano, Steve Lacy on soprano saxophone, Arthur Blythe on alto saxophone, Pit Levin on synthesizers, Earl McIntyre on trombone, Lewis Soloff on trumpet, Geoffrey Berlin on bass and Sue Evans on percussion instruments. The second concert features saxophonist Ornette Coleman at the peak of his musically expressive powers. Coleman is joined by Bern Nix on guitar, Charles Ellerbee on guitar, Albert Arnold on bass, and Shannon Jackson on drums and percussion.

programme.title: Sunshine (I Can Fly)
programme.desc: Raul Midon appeared at 2017’s Sing Jazz Festival in Singapore with double bassist Romeir Mendez and drummer Billy Williams. Blind since birth, Raul Midon is a singer, guitarist, and songwriter from New Mexico. With a vocal range as dynamic as his guitar playing and a remarkable talent for trumpet mimicry, Midon’s performances transcend musical boundaries, effortlessly blending rock, jazz, folk, and Latin pop into his unique sound. He has worked with numerous legends, including Bill Withers, Herbie Hancock, Sting, and Dianne Reeves, and his album ‘Bad Ass and Blind’ was nominated for a Grammy Award for Best Jazz Vocal Album in 2018. No wonder the Sing Jazz audience were ecstatic!

programme.title: Art Blakey and The Jazz Messengers - Paris, Part I
programme.desc: Art Blakey and The Jazz Messengers - Paris, Part IEsta transmision es la primera parte de un concierto realizado por Art Blakey and the Jazz Messengers en el Théâtre des Champs Elysées de París en diciembre de 1959.

programme.title: Katche and Origlio Quartet feat. Walter Ricci
programme.desc: Four exceptional musicians team up to perform classic pop and soul songs made famous by the likes of Gregory Porter, Stevie Wonder, U2, Seal, and many more. Pianist Alfio Origlio signed up to do the arrangements. Walter Ricci, an accomplished jazz vocalist from Naples, eases us into his musical universe with his stunning sensitivity. He is accompanied by an exceptional rhythm section composed of Manu Katche on drums, Jerôme Regard on bass, and Alfio Origlio on piano. This concert was recorded at Festival Jazz au Sommet 2020 in France.

programme.title: Jaco Pastorius
programme.desc: The audience at the Montreal Jazz Festival in Canada was in for a treat on July 3, 1982, as a true musical innovator hit the stage: Jaco Pastorius, who transformed the electric bass into a formidable solo instrument. Combining intricate harmonics, fluid melodies, and unparalleled technical skill, Pastorius left a lasting impact on the music world. In this concert, he is accompanied by Peter Erskine (drums), Don Alias (percussion), Othello Molineaux (steel drums), Bob Mintzer (tenor sax and bass clarinet), and Randy Brecker (trumpet and electronics). They perform “Chicken”, “Donna Lee”, “Mr. Phone Bone”, and “Fannie Mae”. Dont miss this extraordinary opportunity to experience Jaco Pastorius’s electrifying performance at the Montreal Jazz Festival 1982!

programme.title: Winter 1980: Maynard Ferguson Big Band in Brussels
programme.desc: La gira invernal de la Maynard Ferguson Big Band de 1980 incluyo una parada en el Brussels Jazz Club. Esta presentacion de Ferguson y su banda incluye algunos exitos del momento, como "Birdland" de Weather Report y el tema de Rocky, "Gonna Fly Now".

programme.title: Louis Armstrong: Live in Australia
programme.desc: Following a highly successful small-group jazz concert at New York Town Hall on May 17, 1947, Armstrongs manager Joe Glaser dissolved the Armstrong big band on August 13, 1947 and established a six-piece small group. This group was called the All Stars, and in 1964 Louis Armstrong recorded his biggest-selling record, Hello, Dolly! He made assorted television appearances, especially in the 1950s and 1960s – the recorded film was a TV Show in Australia when Armstrong was at the peak of his career. Armstrong kept up his busy tour schedule until a few years before his death in 1971. He also toured Africa, Europe, and Asia under sponsorship of the US State Department with great success, earning the nickname ‘Ambassador Satch’.

programme.title: Caetano Veloso, Aquele Frevo Axe
programme.desc: Pianist Kenny Barron’s June 27, 2019 appearance at the Alfa Jazz Festival in Ukraine’s Lviv was a celebration of sublime jazz virtuosity. The revered elder statesmen of jazz piano brought his regular working trio of Kiyoshi Kitagawa (bass) and Jonathan Blake (drums), augmented by stellar jazzman Marcus Strickland (tenor saxophone) and young lion Riley Mulherkar (trumpet). Their seamless blend of classic bebop and modern explorations spoke of a deep, emotive connection to each note, captivating the Ukrainian audience with lyrical improvisations during this unforgettable concert.

programme.title: Anita Oday Live in Sweden 1963
programme.desc: Anita ODay dio dos maravillosos conciertos en 1963 y 1970, que presentan a la “cantante suprema de jazz" en impecable forma. Este espectáculo es testimonio de una de las músicas de jazz más genuinas y muestra sin lugar a duda por que se la considera una vocalista de nivel superior.

programme.title: Somethin
programme.desc: Winner of five Grammys in four consecutive years, including the Grammy for best RandB album in 2017, Lalah Hathaway is a force impossible to ignore. The American artist has shared the scene with Prince, Snoop Dogg, Stevie Wonder, Anita Baker, Mary J. Blige, Frank Ocean and many others, an irrefutable proof of her keen musical sense and enormous talent. With a 26-year career, Hathaway is still highly sought after by the biggest names in music. See her transform the 2018 Sing Jazz festival scene into a real RandB club, where she flaunts her voice and stage presence out of the ordinary.

programme.title: J.E. "Cannonball" Adderley live in Switzerland
programme.desc: Cannonball Adderley: Live in 63 cuenta con dos conciertos hermosamente filmados de uno de los sextetos más famosos de la historia del jazz capturado en el apogeo de su carrera.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Charles Mingus And Eric Dolphy live in Liège
programme.desc: Charles Mingus presenta un concierto excepcional realizado en abril de 1965 con la siguiente formacion: Jaki Byard (piano), Dannie Richmond (batería), Johnny Coles (trompeta), Clifford Jordan (saxofon tenor) y el gran Eric Dolphy (saxofon alto, flauta y clarinete bajo).

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Lianne La Havas’ performance at Casino de Paris captures the British singer-songwriter at her best: with her crystalline voice she performs soulful melodies full of sincerity. The performance is part of La Havas’ Blood Tour, a concert tour promoting her second album Blood (2015). She is accompanied by James Wyatt on keys, Adam Prendergast on bass, Giles King Ashong on drums, and Frida Touray on backing vocals.

programme.title: Fats Domino - The North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: El cantante y pianista estadounidense Fats Domino dio una actuacion inolvidable en el festival North Sea Jazz de 1980. Domino fue uno de los pioneros del rock and roll, con más de 65 millones de discos vendidos y 11 grandes exitos entre 1955 y 1960.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Dee Dee Bridgewater: Motherland
programme.desc: Singer Dee Dee Bridgewater walks in with considerable credentials, but this documentary related to her album ‘Red Earth’ trumps them all: Red Earth is a Malian journey that merges and melts all borders. While world-beat listeners will recognize the grooves, this is Bridgewaters first time bringing her own experiences as an African-American woman back to the motherland. It results in a fusion of feeling, visions, and music.

programme.title: State of Mind
programme.desc: Raul Midon appeared at 2017’s Sing Jazz Festival in Singapore with double bassist Romeir Mendez and drummer Billy Williams. Blind since birth, Raul Midon is a singer, guitarist, and songwriter from New Mexico. With a vocal range as dynamic as his guitar playing and a remarkable talent for trumpet mimicry, Midon’s performances transcend musical boundaries, effortlessly blending rock, jazz, folk, and Latin pop into his unique sound. He has worked with numerous legends, including Bill Withers, Herbie Hancock, Sting, and Dianne Reeves, and his album ‘Bad Ass and Blind’ was nominated for a Grammy Award for Best Jazz Vocal Album in 2018. No wonder the Sing Jazz audience were ecstatic!

programme.title: The Skymasters with Clark Terry - North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: En 1989, la big band y orquesta de radio holandesa The Skymasters alzaron vuelo en el North Sea Jazz Festival de La Haya. La leyenda del jazz Clark Terry los acompaño en la trompeta, el fliscorno y la voz en una colaboracion emocionante.

programme.title: Great Male Vocalists - collage
programme.desc: This selection of unforgettable performances by some of the most iconic and influential male jazz and pop vocalists in history showcases these legends’ unique essence. Delight in the expressive beauty and emotional depth of Chet Bakers rendition of “Time After Time” and “You Dont Know What Love Is

Blige, Frank Ocean and many others, an irrefutable proof of her keen musical sense and enormous talent. With a 26-year career, Hathaway is still highly sought after by the biggest names in music. See her transform the 2018 Sing Jazz festival scene into a real RandB club, where she flaunts her voice and stage presence out of the ordinary.

programme.title: Alfa Jazz Festival Lviv, Oekraïne
programme.desc: Double bassist Avishai Cohen’s trio with Noam David (drums) and Omri Mor (pianist) joined forces with the international Symphony Orchestra ‘INSO-Lviv’, conducted by Christian Schumann. On June 24, 2017 they brought Avishai Cohen’s signature blend of influences from Eastern Europe, American jazz and the Middle East to the Alfa Jazz Festival in Lviv, Ukraine. Cohen, who also supplies vocalizations in the Judeo-Spanish dialect Ladino, came to prominence internationally in the 1990s when jazz great Chick Corea offered him a place in his trio and a recording deal. Thirty years later, Cohen has become a house-hold name himself, leaving his Ukrainian audience enthralled and connected through the universal language of music.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: The Blue Note Masters
programme.desc: Ron Carter, Bobby Hutcherson y Joe Chambers son leyendas de Blue Note Records. Se han establecido como líderes de banda, compositores y músicos de estudio innovadores y con vision de futuro. (1997)

programme.title: The Mel Lewis Orchestra live at Estival Lugano
programme.desc: Estival ofrece una emocionante y particularmente sorprendente programacion que explora el rico mundo de la música contemporánea. Es posible que la Mel Lewis Orchestra haya sido la big band más influyente desde la era del swing.

programme.title: All of You
programme.desc: American trumpeter Miles Davis (1926-1991) was a pioneering jazz musician from the late 1940s to the late 1980s. His influence on 20th century music is hard to overstate, as he trailblazed bebop, cool jazz, hardbop, modal jazz, and electronic music. On October 11, 1964, Miles Davis performed at Teatro Dell’Arte in Milan. With tenor saxophonist Wayne Shorter, pianist Herbie Hancock, bassist Ron Carter and drummer Tony Williams, Davis performed Autumn Leaves, My Funny Valentine, All Blues, All of You, and Joshua.

programme.title: Charles Bradley at La Cigale
programme.desc: La dulce recompensa. Observa a este hombre alcanzar su momento tras años de esfuerzo y lucha. Charles Bradley, de 64 años, se entrega por completo, emocionado, sincero, con fuerza y energía. Mostrando su fe, moviendo montañas.

programme.title: Gilberto Gil: Jazz à Vienne
programme.desc: El artista brasileño Gilberto Gil regresa al Jazz à Vienne con música inspirada en su último disco, "Fe na Festa": una mezcla de celebracion, tradicion y hasta algo de rock. Aunque sus nuevos sonidos tienen sus raíces en la cultura brasileña, siempre están inspirados en el jazz.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Obatalà
programme.desc: Legendary Cuban pianist Chucho Valdes brought his band ‘Jazz Batá 2’ to the Malta Jazz Festival on July 19, 2019. The air was thick with anticipation as Valdes took to the stage, revisiting the small-group concept of his mythical 1972 Cuban album ‘Jazz Batá’. The batá repertoire – the deep classical music of West Africa – permeates Valdés’ piano solos throughout the concert. Valdes’s band consists of Dreiser Durruthy (Batas and vocals), Yaroldy Abreu (percussions and vocals), Abraham Mansfarroll (percussion), Ramon Vazquez Martirena-Bajo (bass guitar). They delivered a performance that reverberated through the historic island.

programme.title: Arturo Sandoval - North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festival’s staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1986, Cuban trumpeter Arturo Sandoval brought his band with him to the North Sea Jazz Festival in The Hague. Featuring talented performers like pianist Hilario Durán and guitarist Jorge Chicoy, they displayed a master class in Latin jazz fusion.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Smith, Adderley, Brubeck, Mingus - Newport Jazz F.
programme.desc: En 1972, un impresionante reparto toco codo a codo en el Newport Jazz Festival de Roterdam. Estos cuatro grupos magistrales eran el Cannonball Adderley Quintet, Jimmy Smith y su banda, el Dave Brubeck Trio y el Charles Mingus Sextet.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Joe Zawinul - Munchner Klaviersommer
programme.desc: Munchner Klaviersommer was an annual concerts series that took place from 1981 to 1998 in Munich, Germany. Although the festivals name suggests a strong focus on piano music, it featured countless famous musicians from jazz and classical music – not just pianists. In 1985, Viennese keyboardist Joe Zawinul was one of the artists appearing at this festival. Zawinul performed on a huge synthesizer outfit in this concert, recorded live at the Kongressaal in Munich, Germany.

programme.title: Great Jazz Pianists
programme.desc: Embark on a remarkable journey through the world of jazz piano as we showcase some of the most iconic and influential pianists in history. This collection of extraordinary performances captures the unique essence and brilliance of legendary pianists Art Tatum, Thelonious Monk, Bud Powell, and others. Revel in Oscar Peterson’s virtuosity as his trio plays “C-Jam Blues” in Holbaek, Denmark, on May 2, 1964. Let the sublime artistry of Art Tatum captivate you as he interprets Antonín Dvořáks “Humoresque” in 1953. Discover Thelonious Monk’s enigmatic genius as his quartet performs his iconic composition “Round About Midnight” in Poland on April 4, 1966. Experience the timeless appeal of the Dave Brubeck Quartets odd-metered “Take Five

programme.title: George Shearing Duo feat. Neil Swainson
programme.desc: British pianist George Shearing enjoyed an international reputation as an instrumentalist, arranger, and composer. Equally at home on the classical concert stage as in jazz clubs, he was recognized for his inventive, orchestrated jazz. In this live recording from the Munich Philharmonie, Shearing played in a duo format with Canadian double bassist Neil Swainson. The repertoire consisted of a selection of compositions by Shearing himself, among them ‘Lullaby Of Birdland’, which is a standard in jazz repertoire.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Chick Corea and Friends
programme.desc: Muchas de las composiciones de Chick Corea se consideran estándares de jazz. Este especial presenta tres actuaciones que demuestran sus diferentes talentos.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Carla Bley Sextet live at Estival Lugano 1986
programme.desc: Estival ofrece una emocionante y particularmente sorprendente programacion que explora el rico mundo de la música contemporánea. Descubre el vínculo especial entre la pianista Carla Bley y el bajista Steve Swallow. Ambos han tocado en las mismas bandas desde los años 60.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Omar Sosa - Quarteto Afrocubano
programme.desc: Para su actuacion de 2018 en el Theâtre de Villefranche-sur-Saône, Omar Sosa presenta a los miembros de su Quarteto Afrocubano, Childo Tomas (bajo electrico y voz), Ernesto Simpson (batería) y Leandro Saint-Hill (saxofones, flauta, percusion y voz).

programme.title: Great Guitarists - Collage
programme.desc: This selection of unforgettable performances by some of the most iconic and influential jazz guitarists in history showcases these legends’ unique essence. Revel in Wes Montgomery’s virtuosity as he performs the captivating “Nicas Dream” in Holland in 1965, and delight in the expressive beauty of his rendition of “Heres That Rainy Day”, recorded in London in that same year. Experience the timeless appeal of Joe Passs “You Stepped Out of a Dream” and “You Turned The Tables on Me”, recorded live in Hanover in 1975. The interplay between Jim Hall and Atilla Zoller borders on the impossible as they perform “Extensions” in Hanover in 1973. Enjoy Jim Halls lyrical solo performance of “Im Getting Sentimental Over You” from 1964. Witness Sonny Sharrock’s avant-garde fusion of jazz and rock in an exhilarating performance of “Peanut

programme.title: Munchner Klaviersommer: Eliane Elias Trio
programme.desc: Las raíces de samba brasileña de Eliane Elias y su voz sensual y cautivadora son la combinacion perfecta para su impresionante habilidad en bebop instrumental, jazz y música clásica. En este concierto de Munchner Klaviersommer de 1991, esta gran mujer se presenta con su propio trío.

programme.title: Things Are Here
programme.desc: American jazz trumpeter, composer, and bandleader Dizzy Gillespie (1917-1993) was one of the seminal figures of the bebop movement. He fuses all musical forms rooted in African culture, such as music from Cuba, Latin America and the Caribbean, into his music. On November 4, 1970 he played a concert in Denmark with the Kenny Clarke/Francy Boland Big Band, performing Con Alma, Brother K, Now Hear My Meanin’, Manteca, Let Me Outta Here, and Things Are Here.

programme.title: The Tallberg Foundation: "Jazz for the Planet"
programme.desc: On October 19, 2021, John Patitucci (bass), Marco Pignataro (sax and musical director), and Joe Lovano (sax) showcased inspirational new originals at GBHs Fraser Performance Studio in Boston, MA, accompanied by Terri Lyne Carrington (drums), Nadia Washington (vocals), Chico Pinheiro (guitar), and Anastassiya Petrova (piano). This recording, titled Tallberg’s Jazz for the Planet, was made in support of the Tallberg Foundation’s message and aims to inspire positive climate action. Since 1981, the Tallberg Foundation has been trying to nurture new thinking, in part by looking at societal challenges through the lenses of artists.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips

programme.title: Keith Jarrett - Estival Jazz Lugano
programme.desc: En 1986, el bajista Gary Peacock y el baterista Jack DeJohnette acompañan al pianista y compositor estadounidense Keith Jarrett en el Estival Jazz Lugano. Conocidos como el Standards Trio, ofrecieron una actuacion cautivadora que muestra a estos músicos magistrales en su mejor momento.

programme.title: Josh Evans - Ballad Of Ernie Washington
programme.desc: On July 20, 2018, double bassist Christian McBride presented his band ‘New Jawn’ at the Malta Jazz Festival. A five-time Grammy winner, McBride is one of the most requested, most recorded, and most respected figures in the music world today. Hailing from Philadelphia, this music luminary combines jazz, RandB, pop/rock, hip hop/neo-soul, and classical. Gracing the Malta Jazz stage with him are Nasheet Waits (drums), Marcus Strickland (tenor sax), and Josh Evans (trumpet).

programme.title: Al di Meola - Munchner Klaviersommer
programme.desc: En Munchner Klaviersommer de 1993, el guitarrista estadounidense Al Di Meola interpreto el ahora clásico repertorio de fusion de música del mundo de su álbum "World Sinfonia" de 1991, con el segundo guitarrista Chris Carrington y el percusionista Arto Tunçboyacıyan.

programme.title: B.B. King Orchestra - The North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: En 1979, el legendario guitarrista de blues estadounidense B. B. King ofrecio una presentacion inolvidable para el público en Den Haag. King, uno de los guitarristas más influyentes de todos los tiempos, toco junto con su propia orquesta.

programme.title: Ryan Porter and The West Coast Get Down - BIRD
programme.desc: El saxofonista Kamasi Washington y el trombonista Ryan Porter, nacidos en Los Ángeles, cofundaron West Coast Get Down, un colectivo musical que fusiona jazz y funk con hiphop. Los dos músicos unen sus fuerzas y llevan las vibras de Los Ángeles a Roterdam, Países Bajos.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Brussels Jazz Orchestra: Changing Faces
programme.desc: La Brussels Jazz Orchestra (BJO) no es el tipo de orquesta de jazz que se ajusta a los estándares. Durante este proyecto, la BJO actúa con el cantante de jazz belga David Linx, que recurre a cualquier expresion, a cualquier lenguaje y a cualquier compás.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Marcus Miller: Thoughts on Miles
programme.desc: This portrait of Marcus Miller was recorded during his 2009 ‘Tutu Revisited’ tour. Miller looks back on his relationship with Miles Davis. Miller tells us about writing his composition Tutu, and shares countless stories of the recording process of the album Tutu. This documentary was filmed in 2009 at the We Want Miles exhibition in Cite de la Musique in Paris.

programme.title: Lulu’s Back In Town
programme.desc: The idiosyncratic pianist and composer Thelonious Monk (1917-1982) is one of the all-time greats of jazz. His music went largely misunderstood for the first 15 years of his career, after which he was rightly hailed as a genius, and received credit as a founding father of bebop. Several concerts from his 1966 European tour were recorded for television, featuring his quartet of Charles Rouse (tenor saxophone), Lawrence Gales (bass) and Benjamin Riley (drums). His quartet performed Epistrophy, Round Midnight, and Lulus Back in Town in Warsaw for Polish television on April 4, 1966. On April 17, the same quartet performed a short set in Copenhagen for Danish television, featuring Lulus Back in Town, Dont Blame Me, and Epistrophy.

programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Soul Makossa: Manu Dibango in Stuttgart
programme.desc: Manu Dibango, el más grande de los saxofonistas africanos, es uno de los fundadores de un estilo musical africano moderno abierto al jazz, el RandB, la salsa, el gospel, el funk y el reggae.

programme.title: Tony Bennett
programme.desc: Relive the magic of one of the most beloved crooners in music history in his prime: Tony Bennett! Recorded live in London’s Royal Albert Hall on March 2, 1974, this enchanting performance showcases Bennetts remarkable vocal prowess and charisma to full effect. Bennett is accompanied by his musical director Torrie Zito and an orchestra of British musicians that includes Kenny Clare (drums), Don Lusher (trombone), and Kenny Baker (trumpet). Tune in for Bennett’s captivating take on songs “The Good Things in Life”, “My Favorite Things”, “My Love”, “I’ve Got Five Dollars”, “It Don’t Mean a Thing”, and “Maybe This Time” in this magical concert recording.

programme.title: Great Male Vocalists - collage
programme.desc: This selection of unforgettable performances by some of the most iconic and influential male jazz and pop vocalists in history showcases these legends’ unique essence. Delight in the expressive beauty and emotional depth of Chet Bakers rendition of “Time After Time” and “You Dont Know What Love Is

programme.title: Solo Piano Summit
programme.desc: El "Solo Piano Summit" reúne a un puñado de pianistas de primer nivel con diferentes orígenes musicales: Jacky Terrasson, Junior Mance, Geoff Keezer, Bill Charlap y Alex Wilson.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Keith Jarrett - Estival Jazz Lugano
programme.desc: En 1986, el bajista Gary Peacock y el baterista Jack DeJohnette acompañan al pianista y compositor estadounidense Keith Jarrett en el Estival Jazz Lugano. Conocidos como el Standards Trio, ofrecieron una actuacion cautivadora que muestra a estos músicos magistrales en su mejor momento.

programme.title: Josh Evans - Ballad Of Ernie Washington
programme.desc: On July 20, 2018, double bassist Christian McBride presented his band ‘New Jawn’ at the Malta Jazz Festival. A five-time Grammy winner, McBride is one of the most requested, most recorded, and most respected figures in the music world today. Hailing from Philadelphia, this music luminary combines jazz, RandB, pop/rock, hip hop/neo-soul, and classical. Gracing the Malta Jazz stage with him are Nasheet Waits (drums), Marcus Strickland (tenor sax), and Josh Evans (trumpet).

programme.title: Al di Meola - Munchner Klaviersommer
programme.desc: En Munchner Klaviersommer de 1993, el guitarrista estadounidense Al Di Meola interpreto el ahora clásico repertorio de fusion de música del mundo de su álbum "World Sinfonia" de 1991, con el segundo guitarrista Chris Carrington y el percusionista Arto Tunçboyacıyan.

programme.title: Great Jazz Pianists
programme.desc: Embark on a remarkable journey through the world of jazz piano as we showcase some of the most iconic and influential pianists in history. This collection of extraordinary performances captures the unique essence and brilliance of legendary pianists Art Tatum, Thelonious Monk, Bud Powell, and others. Revel in Oscar Peterson’s virtuosity as his trio plays “C-Jam Blues” in Holbaek, Denmark, on May 2, 1964. Let the sublime artistry of Art Tatum captivate you as he interprets Antonín Dvořáks “Humoresque” in 1953. Discover Thelonious Monk’s enigmatic genius as his quartet performs his iconic composition “Round About Midnight” in Poland on April 4, 1966. Experience the timeless appeal of the Dave Brubeck Quartets odd-metered “Take Five

programme.title: B.B. King Orchestra - The North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: En 1979, el legendario guitarrista de blues estadounidense B. B. King ofrecio una presentacion inolvidable para el público en Den Haag. King, uno de los guitarristas más influyentes de todos los tiempos, toco junto con su propia orquesta.

programme.title: Arturo Sandoval - North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festival’s staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1986, Cuban trumpeter Arturo Sandoval brought his band with him to the North Sea Jazz Festival in The Hague. Featuring talented performers like pianist Hilario Durán and guitarist Jorge Chicoy, they displayed a master class in Latin jazz fusion.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Gonzalo Rubalcaba Trio - Munchner Klaviersommer
programme.desc: Munchner Klaviersommer was an annual concerts series that took place from 1981 to 1998 in Munich, Germany. Although the festivals name suggests a strong focus on piano music, it featured countless famous musicians from jazz and classical music – not just pianists. The concerts were usually held in July at The Gasteig, home of the Munich Philharmonic. In 1994, Cuban pianist Gonzalo Rubalcaba was one of the artists appearing here. With bassist Ron Carter - one of the living legends on this instrument - and highly talented Cuban jazz drummer Julio Barreto, Rubalcabas trio marks an important step in the development of jazz trio playing in the 1990s. Moreover, it demonstrates the brilliant improvisational and technical abilities of Gonzalo Rubalcaba, who has become one of our present-day jazz legends.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: John Coltrane
programme.desc: Explore the music of one of the most influential and innovative saxophonists in jazz history: John Coltrane! Immerse yourself in this collection of remarkable performances from the early 1960s that showcase Coltranes unparalleled artistry and unique sound during a transformative period in the artist’s career. Recorded in various European cities, Coltrane is seen playing the songs “Autumn Leaves”, “Hackensack”, “My Favorite Things”, “I Want To Talk About You”, “Vigil”, and “Naima”. Tune in and experience why the music of John Coltrane has touched the lives of so many!

programme.title: Miriam Makeba Live at Estival Lugano 1985
programme.desc: La sudafricana Miriam Makeba, tambien llamada Mamá África, fue una cantante, actriz, embajadora de buena voluntad de las Naciones Unidas y activista por los derechos civiles. Llevo la música africana al público occidental y popularizo los generos de música del mundo y afropop.

programme.title: Thelonious Monk, Well You Neednt
programme.desc: Pianist Kenny Barron’s June 27, 2019 appearance at the Alfa Jazz Festival in Ukraine’s Lviv was a celebration of sublime jazz virtuosity. The revered elder statesmen of jazz piano brought his regular working trio of Kiyoshi Kitagawa (bass) and Jonathan Blake (drums), augmented by stellar jazzman Marcus Strickland (tenor saxophone) and young lion Riley Mulherkar (trumpet). Their seamless blend of classic bebop and modern explorations spoke of a deep, emotive connection to each note, captivating the Ukrainian audience with lyrical improvisations during this unforgettable concert.

programme.title: Wayne Shorter Quintet - Estival Jazz Lugano
programme.desc: En 1996, el famoso saxofonista estadounidense Wayne Shorter y su quinteto actuaron en el Estival Jazz Lugano. Junto con el pianista Jim Beard, el guitarrista David Gilmore, el bajista Alphonso Johnson y el baterista Rodney van Holmes, Shorter muestra que todavía está en su mejor momento.

programme.title: John Coltrane
programme.desc: Explore the music of one of the most influential and innovative saxophonists in jazz history: John Coltrane! Immerse yourself in this collection of remarkable performances from the early 1960s that showcase Coltranes unparalleled artistry and unique sound during a transformative period in the artist’s career. Recorded in various European cities, Coltrane is seen playing the songs “Autumn Leaves”, “Hackensack”, “My Favorite Things”, “I Want To Talk About You”, “Vigil”, and “Naima”. Tune in and experience why the music of John Coltrane has touched the lives of so many!

programme.title: Malta Jazz Festival
programme.desc: On July 20, 2018, double bassist Christian McBride presented his band ‘New Jawn’ at the Malta Jazz Festival. A five-time Grammy winner, McBride is one of the most requested, most recorded, and most respected figures in the music world today. Hailing from Philadelphia, this music luminary combines jazz, RandB, pop/rock, hip hop/neo-soul, and classical. Gracing the Malta Jazz stage with him are Nasheet Waits (drums), Marcus Strickland (tenor sax), and Josh Evans (trumpet).

programme.title: Episode 3: Miles Davis - Jazz Greats
programme.desc: El trompetista estadounidense Miles Davis fue pionero del bebop, el cool jazz, el hardbop, el jazz modal y la música electronica. El 11 de octubre de 1964 actuo en Milán con el saxofonista tenor Wayne Shorter, el pianista Herbie Hancock, el bajista Ron Carter y el baterista Tony Williams.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Con Alma
programme.desc: American jazz trumpeter, composer, and bandleader Dizzy Gillespie (1917-1993) was one of the seminal figures of the bebop movement. He fuses all musical forms rooted in African culture, such as music from Cuba, Latin America and the Caribbean, into his music. On November 4, 1970 he played a concert in Denmark with the Kenny Clarke/Francy Boland Big Band, performing Con Alma, Brother K, Now Hear My Meanin’, Manteca, Let Me Outta Here, and Things Are Here.

programme.title: Cambio Climático
programme.desc: - Así se inundarán ciudades como Londres o Nueva York con la subida del nivel del mar. - El planeta es cada vez más verde pero no es tan buena noticia. - Las cinco islas de plástico que manchan el oceano y ningún país quiere limpiar. - El dantesco mapa de los incendios del Amazonas: por aquí arde realmente el pulmon del planeta.

programme.title: Trump 2.0
programme.desc: - El mal negocio de la paz en Ucrania: ¿Que buscan Putin y Trump de Zelensky? - Muchas razones por las que Canadá no se uniría nunca a Estados Unidos (y unas pocas por las que sí). - El plan de Trump para quedarse con el Canal de Panamá y el Golfo de Mexico de una tacada. - Lo que Donald Trump quiere de Groenlandia: minerales, bases y el poder en el centro del Ártico

programme.title: Observatorio
programme.desc: - El enigma del metano: el gas que contamina más del CO² y que China, India y Rusia no quieren detener. - El petroleo se está agotando y las renovables no son la solucion a la crisis energetica. - Así el misil hipersonico de China, ha convertido en chatarra los viejos cohetes de EE.UU. - Safer: el barco zombi cargado de petroleo que la guerra en Yemen ha convertido en una bomba.

programme.title: Geo
programme.desc: - ¿Como se ha convertido Rusia en el país más grande (y más rico de recursos naturales) del mundo? - Kazajistán: el tesoro energetico escondido bajo tierra que Rusia no puede perder. - Marruecos: la potencia enseña los dientes a España y quiere controlar el Magreb. - La crisis energetica del gas natural que amenaza la recuperacion mundial.

programme.desc: Control Z Ep1 | El fenomeno natural que nos devolverá a la Edad Media. - Control Z Ep2 | Así será la guerra del futuro y sus devastadores efectos. - Control Z. programme.title: Observatorio
programme.desc: ¿La energía del futuro? El camino hacia el primer reactor de fusion nuclear de la historia. - Como se convirtio el ingles en el idioma más útil del mundo. - El exodo de Silicon Valley: ¿por que las Big Tech abandonan San Francisco y se mudan a Austin?

programme.title: Lo último
programme.desc: Para saber como es el futuro del coche electrico solo hay que mirar a Noruega. - ¿Funciona de verdad el escudo anti-misiles nucleares de Estados Unidos?. - Los Emiratos buscan recuperar su ancestral poder marítimo global más allá del Golfo. - La carrera militar por el control del Ártico donde Rusia tiene todas las de ganar. - ¿Cuándo se podrá navegar por el Ártico? Rusia y China tienen un plan.

programme.title: Geo: El Confidencial
programme.desc: Así consiguieron el poder los talibanes en Afganistán tras las invasiones de EEUU y la URSS. - Tigray: la region de Etiopia que se rebela en contra de un Premio Nobel de la Paz. - La isla de los microchips: lo que pasa en Taiwan afecta a todo el mundo. - ¿Que pasa exactamente en Bielorrusia? Tras el telon de la última dictadura de Europa.

programme.title: Documentales The Guardian
programme.desc: La mujer que está creando un"ejercito" de Gretas Thunberg - El plan de Kazajistán para ser la nueva superpotencia de energías renovables de Asia.

programme.title: Cambio climático
programme.desc: Salud o comida: la falta de alimentos por el Covid de la que avisaron FAO y Banco Mundial. - ¿La Antártida se deshiela o está cada vez más fría? programme.title: Observatorio
programme.desc: Marketing olfativo: la "secreta" estrategia de venta a la que no te puedes resistir. - ¿Quien domina el Nilo? La guerra del agua entre Egipto y Etiopía por controlar el gran río africano. - Por que Rusia vendio Alaska a Estados Unidos, su gran rival hoy en la guerra del Ártico. - El papel de las mujeres en Hollywood según el test de Bechdel. - Revival de los formatos físicos: el cassette y el walkman resurgen de sus cenizas.

programme.title: Geo
programme.desc: - "Tzahal: el ejercito de Israel que nunca ha perdido una guerra. - Los mapas de la crisis de Ceuta: así han entrado miles de inmigrantes marroquíes a nado a España.- La rivalidad nuclear entre Francia y Reino Unido que lo explica por que Europa no tiene ejercito. - Islas artificiales y aeropuertos: el plan de Pekín para controlar el Mar del Sur de China.

programme.title: Reportajes
programme.desc: - Jon Fernandez "Jonfer": Con el Mayweather-McGregor se irán muchos prejuicios del boxeo. - Historia de España: 40 años del asesinato de los abogados de Atocha 55. - Viaje a la España vacía de mujeres: ""Vivimos del salario del marido y eso nos perjudico.

programme.title: Cambio Climático
programme.desc: - Así se inundarán ciudades como Londres o Nueva York con la subida del nivel del mar. - El planeta es cada vez más verde pero no es tan buena noticia. - Las cinco islas de plástico que manchan el oceano y ningún país quiere limpiar. - El dantesco mapa de los incendios del Amazonas: por aquí arde realmente el pulmon del planeta.

programme.title: Reportajes
programme.desc: Tierras raras en La Mancha: entre la oportunidad y el desastre. - La Exclusiva, el milagro contra el abandono de los pueblos. - De Madrid a Valencia: viaje por pueblos que murieron con la N-III. - Colomares: el castillo-monumento a Colon más raro del mundo.

programme.title: Observatorio
programme.desc: ¿La energía del futuro? El camino hacia el primer reactor de fusion nuclear de la historia. - Como se convirtio el ingles en el idioma más útil del mundo. - El exodo de Silicon Valley: ¿por que las Big Tech abandonan San Francisco y se mudan a Austin?

programme.title: Lo último
programme.desc: Para saber como es el futuro del coche electrico solo hay que mirar a Noruega. - ¿Funciona de verdad el escudo anti-misiles nucleares de Estados Unidos?. - Los Emiratos buscan recuperar su ancestral poder marítimo global más allá del Golfo. - La carrera militar por el control del Ártico donde Rusia tiene todas las de ganar. - ¿Cuándo se podrá navegar por el Ártico? Rusia y China tienen un plan.

programme.title: Geo: El Confidencial
programme.desc: Así consiguieron el poder los talibanes en Afganistán tras las invasiones de EEUU y la URSS. - Tigray: la region de Etiopia que se rebela en contra de un Premio Nobel de la Paz. - La isla de los microchips: lo que pasa en Taiwan afecta a todo el mundo. - ¿Que pasa exactamente en Bielorrusia? Tras el telon de la última dictadura de Europa.

programme.title: Observatorio
programme.desc: - El enigma del metano: el gas que contamina más del CO² y que China, India y Rusia no quieren detener. - El petroleo se está agotando y las renovables no son la solucion a la crisis energetica. - Así el misil hipersonico de China, ha convertido en chatarra los viejos cohetes de EE.UU. - Safer: el barco zombi cargado de petroleo que la guerra en Yemen ha convertido en una bomba.

programme.title: Geo
programme.desc: - ¿Como se ha convertido Rusia en el país más grande (y más rico de recursos naturales) del mundo? - Kazajistán: el tesoro energetico escondido bajo tierra que Rusia no puede perder. - Marruecos: la potencia enseña los dientes a España y quiere controlar el Magreb. - La crisis energetica del gas natural que amenaza la recuperacion mundial.

programme.title: Cambio climático
programme.desc: Las cinco islas de plástico que manchan el oceano y ningún país quiere limpiar - El dantesco mapa de los incendios del Amazonas: por aquí arde realmente el pulmon del planeta - ¿Por que no llueve durante meses? El misterio que los científicos no saben resolver - El dato oculto del informe de la ONU sobre el clima: solo las ciudades oasis del norte sobrevivirán - La Gran Muralla Verde del Sahel: 8.000 kms de árboles para frenar el cambio climático en África.

programme.title: Lo último
programme.desc: ¿Puede Trump comprar Groenlandia? Así lo hizo EEUU en el pasado y así podría (o no) ahora - Monaco y su nuevo barrio flotante de 2500 millones de euros solo para superricos - Todos quieren un data center: así son las trituradoras de energía que dan vida a la IA - ¿Ha combatido Ucrania para nada? Putin gana sin vencer y Trump condena a Europa

programme.title: Observatorio
programme.desc: - Reconstruir lo que el volcán destruye: los ejemplos de Hawaii a Guatemala que preceden a La Palma. - Ni gasolina, ni pollo, ni CO2: así es la crisis del desabastecimiento del Reino Unido.- Europa desarmada: por que 1,5 millones de soldados no pueden defender la UE.

programme.desc: - "Tierras raras en La Mancha: entre la oportunidad y el desastre. - La Exclusiva, el milagro contra el abandono de los pueblos. - De Madrid a Valencia: viaje por pueblos que murieron con la N-III. - Colomares: el castillo-monumento a Colon más raro del mundo. - La vida a caballo: así es el trabajo de jockey de carreras.- Como se hace el kebab."

programme.desc: - ¿Como se ha convertido Rusia en el país más grande (y más rico de recursos naturales) del mundo? - Kazajistán: el tesoro energetico escondido bajo tierra que Rusia no puede perder. - Marruecos: la potencia enseña los dientes a España y quiere controlar el Magreb. - La crisis energetica del gas natural que amenaza la recuperacion mundial.

programme.title: Wineman
programme.desc: En una feria de vinos tuvimos la oportunidad de probar una botella de vino ¡con un genio dentro! Surgio la urgente necesidad de ir a conocer el viñedo a partir del cual se había elaborado. Comenzamos así a entender la magia en ese vino. De forma simultánea entendimos que parte de los secretos de la riqueza de la Rioja, está amparada en el valor de sus diferentes sub-zonas y la riqueza de la variedad de sus variedades. Rioja no puede permitirse quedarse dormida, y os aseguro que este vino Azabache, de Rioja Baja, nos ha mantenido despiertos por mucho tiempo.

programme.title: Wineman
programme.desc: El gusto del vino no puede, o mejor dicho, no debe de estar reñido con el gusto del consumidor. Sin embargo, lamentablemente esto sucede. Afortunadamente vamos a tener la oportunidad de visitar a un inquieto elaborador que se va a cuestionar todos y cada uno de los pasos de la elaboracion del vino, desde el campo a la bodega. Él ni siquiera se va a conformar con obtener buenos racimos, sino que se planteará hasta que parte del racimo es mejor para cada estilo de vino ¡ver para creer! y merecerá la pena conocer a Fernando Remírez de Ganuza y a su familia.

programme.title: Wineman
programme.desc: Cultivados a partir de 600 metros de altura, sus viñedos tienen la brotacion más tardía de Europa y gracias a la precocidad de una variedad autoctona, la Tinta Fina, la Ribera del Duero goza de condiciones excepcionales para hacer vino de gran calidad, siempre que se burlen las temibles heladas primaverales. En lo que en otro tiempo fue el corazon de Castilla la Vieja, cuna y frontera de los vinos monacales castellanos, sus vinos hoy no se parecen en nada, no ya a aquellos, sino ni tan siquiera a los elaborados aquí hace tan solo en 30 años. La familia Perez Pascuas, fundadora de la Denominacion de Origen, nos ilustrará sobre su origen.

programme.title: Viajar con niños
programme.desc: La familia británica Drew emprende un insolito periplo alrededor del mundo. Wilco y Anja toman un año sabático en sus respectivos trabajos para viajar por el mundo con sus tres hijos (el benjamín Freddie y los gemelos adoptados Ollie y Max) de apenas un año de edad

programme.title: Wineman
programme.desc: ¿Donde empieza y donde acaba una denominacion de origen? ¿Como son los vinos que están a un lado y a otro de sus fronteras? Para descubrirlo volveremos a Ribera de Duero, y probaremos vinos de dentro y de fuera de sus fronteras, estas a veces son historicas, pero no historias. Hablaremos con Angel Anocibar, el único Doctor en Enología español por la Universidad de Burdeos. Él compartirá con nosotros secretos tecnicos. Terminaremos nuestro viaje por tierras de Castilla, con otro navarro ilustre, descubriendo los vinos del único español galardonado con el premio Pritzker, considerado el premio Nobel de la arquitectura: Don Rafael Moneo.

programme.title: Descubriendo Baleares

programme.title: Mi segunda vuelta al mundo
programme.desc: El presentador se propone recorrer el mundo por segunda vez, pero en esta ocasion en cada destino dedicará tiempo para hacer lo que más le gusta. Visitará aquellos lugares que más le gustaron y hará aquellas actividades que más le apasionan

programme.title: Wineman
programme.desc: Determinados estilos de vinos solo se puedan elaborar en contados años, en los que se producen aparentes adversidades, pero que con la experiencia, ya no se lucha contra la corriente, sino que te unes a ella. Uvas podridas, temperaturas bajo cero… y, aún así, se elaboran vinos. En el corazon de Europa, entre los ríos de Burdeos y a orillas del Rhin, descubriremos que son la podredumbre noble y los vinos de hielo. Descubriremos los secretos de Sauternes, y asistiremos, en Rheingau, a una vendimia a 10 grados bajo cero. En este episodio los elaboradores rezan para que sus uvas, si no maduran, ojalá se pudran o se congelen.

programme.title: Wineman
programme.desc: En una feria de vinos tuvimos la oportunidad de probar una botella de vino ¡con un genio dentro! Surgio la urgente necesidad de ir a conocer el viñedo a partir del cual se había elaborado. Comenzamos así a entender la magia en ese vino. De forma simultánea entendimos que parte de los secretos de la riqueza de la Rioja, está amparada en el valor de sus diferentes sub-zonas y la riqueza de la variedad de sus variedades. Rioja no puede permitirse quedarse dormida, y os aseguro que este vino Azabache, de Rioja Baja, nos ha mantenido despiertos por mucho tiempo.

programme.title: Wineman
programme.desc: El gusto del vino no puede, o mejor dicho, no debe de estar reñido con el gusto del consumidor. Sin embargo, lamentablemente esto sucede. Afortunadamente vamos a tener la oportunidad de visitar a un inquieto elaborador que se va a cuestionar todos y cada uno de los pasos de la elaboracion del vino, desde el campo a la bodega. Él ni siquiera se va a conformar con obtener buenos racimos, sino que se planteará hasta que parte del racimo es mejor para cada estilo de vino ¡ver para creer! y merecerá la pena conocer a Fernando Remírez de Ganuza y a su familia.

programme.title: La isla interior
programme.desc: Gracia, Martín y Coral son tres hermanos que hacen lo que pueden por mantenerse a flote. Saben perfectamente que se necesitan, pero siempre acaban dándose la espalda, al comprobar su incapacidad para ayudarse. programme.title: The Extraordinary Tale of the Times Table
programme.desc: Ésta es la típica historia de “chico conoce chica, chico se enamora de chica, chica sufre un trastorno obsesivo compulsivo. Chico y chica viven felices y comen perdices”.

programme.title: Nuestros hijos
programme.desc: Vera es una madre abnegada, divorciada despues de tres matrimonios y que vive en una familia numerosa que incluye a sus hijos e hijastros. Intrepida y experimentada, ha empuñado las armas para luchar contra la dictadura y ha vivido en varias partes del mundo. Tania, la hija, es más “conservadora” y está casada desde hace 15 años con otra mujer que está embarazada de su primer hijo. Juntas, descubren la belleza de formar parte de una familia contemporánea.

programme.title: Most beautiful island
programme.desc: "Most Beautiful Island" es un escalofriante retrato de la lucha por la supervivencia de una joven indocumentada que busca redimirse de un tortuoso pasado participando en un peligroso juego.

programme.title: La Paradoja de Antares
programme.desc: Alexandra, científica de guardia de un radiotelescopio, recibe una señal que podría responder a una de las preguntas más trascendentales de la humanidad. Solo tiene un par de horas para verificarla, pero un inesperado problema familiar le obligará a librar una dramática lucha interna en una carrera contra reloj por desvelar uno de los mayores misterios del universo.

programme.title: Antonio Machado: Los días azules
programme.desc: Largometraje documental que pretende recuperar la memoria y la obra de Antonio Machado, en el 80 aniversario de su muerte. La vida del poeta como símbolo de la España que se perdio: un canto a la importancia de la cultura para la vida, para el progreso y para crear una sociedad mejor.

programme.title: La Paradoja de Antares
programme.desc: Alexandra, científica de guardia de un radiotelescopio, recibe una señal que podría responder a una de las preguntas más trascendentales de la humanidad. Solo tiene un par de horas para verificarla, pero un inesperado problema familiar le obligará a librar una dramática lucha interna en una carrera contra reloj por desvelar uno de los mayores misterios del universo.

programme.title: Nato 0. El origen del mal
programme.desc: Un asesino en serie anda suelto por las principales calles de Nueva York, matando sin ningún tipo de patron ni perfil de víctima. Para intentar detenerlo, un profesor experto en Criminología (Carlos Olalla) colabora en las investigaciones con una inspectora de policía de homicidios de la Gran Manzana. Una persecucion a vida o muerte para descubrir cuanto antes al criminal porque nadie sabe quien será su proxima víctima.

programme.title: Nuestros hijos
programme.desc: Vera es una madre abnegada, divorciada despues de tres matrimonios y que vive en una familia numerosa que incluye a sus hijos e hijastros. Intrepida y experimentada, ha empuñado las armas para luchar contra la dictadura y ha vivido en varias partes del mundo.
